content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I enjoyed this puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle. Simple but quite enjoyable.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Decently fun, doable, clear description

Similar clashes, although this one is slightly harder:
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/446645d1460b5f9b693032c41f585545a158
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/131883f6b9c5470a66a874fed1470324d7856b

Given the constraints, a BFS/DFS solution is not required.

Input
* Please format "S", "G", "." and "#" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

Output
* Please format "U", "D", "L" and "R" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

Constraints
* Please format "S" and "G" as {{constants}}.

Cases
* Validator 1: Please revise the case so that H = 3 and W = 4. The expected output should be similar to that of Test 1, but not the same.

* Test 2: Please revise the case so that the expected output consists of a number of Ds only.

* Validator 2: Please use Validator 3 here.

* Validator 3: Please revise the case so that the expected output consists of a number of Rs only.

* Please insert a new pair of medium-sized cases between Pair 3 and Pair 4, where 12 ≥ H > W ≥ 7 and the expected output contains R, D, L and U.

Thanks.

Nice find on the related clashes!

Your observation about BFS/DFS is also spot-on. Given that this is a clash, not requiring BFS/DFS is an appropriate design choice.
